instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board ppbus 16.5v
threads.message:
got this new board , changed the isl , still ppbus is 16.5, 

pin 17/18 and pin 27/28 , 3.3ohm and 20 ohm, 

any idea why

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board ppbus 16.5v
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is shorted and always on. Replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>/<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> again as well with <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board ppbus 16.5v
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 32430"]<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is shorted and always on. Replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>/<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> again as well with <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>. [/QUOTE]

superb!!!! i changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> it work like chum!!!!!!!!!! LOVE YOU
